Articles.Content: What if for interstellar travel you could have a part that could freeze kerbals.
Not a bad idea. For some reason I think cryo pods will either be stock or will be added as a mod quickly after release.

What would be the point if kerbals don't use up resources?

Life support still hasn't been confirmed and it seems doubtful it will be included

6 hours ago, mcwaffles2003 said:

What would be the point if kerbals don't use up resources?

Life support still hasn't been confirmed and it seems doubtful it will be included

True LS hasn't be confirmed but I'm thinking of a space efficient storage of Kerbals for the long interstellar missions. I'm figuring that you will need a decent number of Kerbals to start a new colony. It would be easier to put the Kerbals you don't need "asleep" in one or two parts than having to build the extra space on the ship for them.
Timewarp? but cryopods are good if kerbals can die of hunger during timewarp.

13 hours ago, mcwaffles2003 said:

What would be the point if kerbals don't use up resources?

Life support still hasn't been confirmed and it seems doubtful it will be included

i just think they would be cool
Ain't trying to be a jerk about it, but 'it'd be cool' is probably the worse reason to try and introduce something into a game like KSP, which relies HEAVILY on function being greater than form.

1 hour ago, Axelord FTW said:

Ain't trying to be a jerk about it, but 'it'd be cool' is probably the worse reason to try and introduce something into a game like KSP, which relies HEAVILY on function being greater than form.

yes but stripes on the sides of tanks look "cool"  (not to mention it obviously makes the rocket faster)
No no, you got it wrongs. Red paint makes it go faster. That and speed holes.
